# woleet-idserver-api-client

Woleet.ID Server
- API version: 1.0.0

This is Woleet.ID Server API documentation.


*Automatically generated by the [OpenAPI Generator](https://openapi-generator.tech)*


## Requirements

Building the API client library requires:
1. Java 1.8+
2. Maven/Gradle

## Installation

To install the API client library to your local Maven repository, simply execute:

```shell
mvn clean install
```

To deploy it to a remote Maven repository instead, configure the settings of the repository and execute:

```shell
mvn clean deploy
```

Refer to the [OSSRH Guide](http://central.sonatype.org/pages/ossrh-guide.html) for more information.

### Maven users

Add this dependency to your project's POM:

```xml
<dependency>
  <groupId>io.woleet.idserver</groupId>
  <artifactId>woleet-idserver-api-client</artifactId>
  <version>1.0.0</version>
  <scope>compile</scope>
</dependency>
```

### Gradle users

Add this dependency to your project's build file:

```groovy
compile "io.woleet.idserver:woleet-idserver-api-client:1.0.0"
```

### Others

At first generate the JAR by executing:

```shell
mvn clean package
```

Then manually install the following JARs:

* `target/woleet-idserver-api-client-1.0.0.jar`
* `target/lib/*.jar`

## Getting Started

Please follow the [installation](#installation) instruction and execute the following Java code:

```java

import io.woleet.idserver.*;
import io.woleet.idserver.auth.*;
import io.woleet.idserver.api.model.*;
import io.woleet.idserver.api.ApiTokenApi;

import java.io.File;
import java.util.*;

public class ApiTokenApiExample {

    public static void main(String[] args) {
        ApiClient defaultClient = Configuration.getDefaultApiClient();
        
        // Configure HTTP basic authorization: BearerAuth
        HttpBasicAuth BearerAuth = (HttpBasicAuth) defaultClient.getAuthentication("BearerAuth");
        BearerAuth.setUsername("YOUR USERNAME");
        BearerAuth.setPassword("YOUR PASSWORD");

        ApiTokenApi apiInstance = new ApiTokenApi();
        APITokenPost apITokenPost = new APITokenPost(); // APITokenPost | Created API token object.
        try {
            APIToken result = apiInstance.createAPIToken(apITokenPost);
            System.out.println(result);
        } catch (ApiException e) {
            System.err.println("Exception when calling ApiTokenApi#createAPIToken");
            e.printStackTrace();
        }
    }
}

```

## Documentation for API Endpoints

All URIs are relative to *http://localhost*

Class | Method | HTTP request | Description
------------ | ------------- | ------------- | -------------
*ApiTokenApi* | [**createAPIToken**](docs/ApiTokenApi.md#createAPIToken) | **POST** /APIToken | Create an API token suitable to call the /sign endpoint.
*ApiTokenApi* | [**deleteAPIToken**](docs/ApiTokenApi.md#deleteAPIToken) | **DELETE** /APIToken/{APITokenId} | Delete an API token.
*ApiTokenApi* | [**getAPITokenById**](docs/ApiTokenApi.md#getAPITokenById) | **GET** /APIToken/{APITokenId} | Get an API token by its identifier.
*ApiTokenApi* | [**getAllAPITokens**](docs/ApiTokenApi.md#getAllAPITokens) | **GET** /APIToken/list | List all API tokens.
*ApiTokenApi* | [**updateAPIToken**](docs/ApiTokenApi.md#updateAPIToken) | **PUT** /APIToken/{APITokenId} | Update an API token.
*AuthenticationApi* | [**getUserInfo**](docs/AuthenticationApi.md#getUserInfo) | **GET** /info | Return information about the current logged user.
*AuthenticationApi* | [**login**](docs/AuthenticationApi.md#login) | **GET** /login | Log into the system. Both email or username can be used to authentify.
*AuthenticationApi* | [**logout**](docs/AuthenticationApi.md#logout) | **GET** /logout | Log out from the system.
*IdentityApi* | [**getIdentity**](docs/IdentityApi.md#getIdentity) | **GET** /identity | Prove and get the identity of a user.
*KeyApi* | [**createKey**](docs/KeyApi.md#createKey) | **POST** /user/{userId}/key | Create a new key for a user.
*KeyApi* | [**deleteKey**](docs/KeyApi.md#deleteKey) | **DELETE** /key/{keyId} | Deletes a key
*KeyApi* | [**exportKey**](docs/KeyApi.md#exportKey) | **GET** /key/{keyId}/export | Get the secret recoveryphrase associated to a key.
*KeyApi* | [**getKeyById**](docs/KeyApi.md#getKeyById) | **GET** /key/{keyId} | Get a key by its identifier.
*KeyApi* | [**getKeyById_0**](docs/KeyApi.md#getKeyById_0) | **GET** /user/{userId}/key/list | List all keys of a user.
*KeyApi* | [**updateKey**](docs/KeyApi.md#updateKey) | **PUT** /key/{keyId} | Update an existing key.
*SignatureApi* | [**getSignature**](docs/SignatureApi.md#getSignature) | **GET** /sign | Sign some data using a user key.
*UserApi* | [**createUser**](docs/UserApi.md#createUser) | **POST** /user | Create a new user.
*UserApi* | [**deleteUser**](docs/UserApi.md#deleteUser) | **DELETE** /user/{userId} | Delete a user.
*UserApi* | [**getAllUsers**](docs/UserApi.md#getAllUsers) | **GET** /user/list | List all users.
*UserApi* | [**getUserById**](docs/UserApi.md#getUserById) | **GET** /user/{userId} | Get a user by his identifier.
*UserApi* | [**updateUser**](docs/UserApi.md#updateUser) | **PUT** /user/{userId} | Update a user.

## Documentation for Authorization

Authentication schemes defined for the API:
### APITokenAuth

- **Type**: HTTP basic authentication

### BasicAuth

- **Type**: HTTP basic authentication

### BearerAuth

- **Type**: HTTP basic authentication


## Recommendation

It's recommended to create an instance of `ApiClient` per thread in a multithreaded environment to avoid any potential issues.
